Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2009 07:23PM mikita5 wrote: Hey oldlady: I had a bilat mx with DIEP  reconstruction on March 30th.  I had cancer in one boob but decided to have both taken rather than waiting for the other shoe to drop. It was a very tough surgery and a tough recovery, but I did it and I'd do it all again in a heartbeat. My suggestion is to research, read, research, read, research.........make sure this is what you want and be sure it's the right thing for you.  I had DCIS in my right breast. After mx, pathology came back with 2 more spots in that breast, so my decision was the right one --- for me.. Good luck in your decision. Please come back and let us know what you decide.

Posts.Content: mikita5 wrote: I had bilat mx and DIEP 4 yrs ago.  A friend has been diagnosed with BC about 1-1/2 months ago. Only thing she knows is that it is invasive and grade 1.  She met with the surgeon last week and with the plastic surgeon today. Today she learned  she has stretch marks on her tummy and is not a candidate for DIEP or TRAM. Is this so? I've never heard of this.. Also, she won't have surgery until Aug 7th, which will make it almost 2 months since diagnosis.  The plastic surgeon also put her on ARIMIDEX and said it would stop the growth of the cancer until surgery.. Is this true also? If God leads you TO it, he'll lead you THRU it! Dx 1/2/2008, DCIS, 1cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: I'm looking at brain mets, also... SunshineSmiles denise1962

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2011 11:52AM mikita5 wrote: I, too,  tested negative for BRCA1 and BRCA2, yet there I was with bc.  Oncologist was surprised... I opted for bilat mx altho I only had cancer in one breast (against the advice of everyone I knew, I might add)... Pathology came back with 2 more areas of cancer....Tested negative, only one spot showed up on mammogram, had 2 more that I would have been dealing with in the near future if I'd only had the lumpectomy. . Did I want to go thru that again??? DUH........yep, I made the right decision!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   We should not condem anyone for having a mx, whether they have bc or not. It's a decision we all have to make for ourselves.  My mother died of ovarian cancer. Thirty yrs later I had an oopherectomy. Was that wrong?  I think not!

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2011 10:07AM mikita5 wrote: TOWNY:   AMEN, SISTER  ! ! ! ! ! !  I've never heard that about dense breasts and I had them.  I knew I had calcifications for a couple yrs, but no one suggested cancer until they formed their cluster.  I had the 'cancer free' one removed too and I don't regret it.  If I had to do it again, I'd do it all the same! If anyone can avoid bc, I say, DO IT!!!

Posts.Title: Pot ~ weed ~ and other cures. :) lisa34lisa radiant

Posts.Content: Jun 5, 2009 01:44AM mikita5 wrote: I was diagnosed with DCIS (one spot) in right breast in Jan -'09. I knew immediately that I would have a bilat MX.. My oncologist tried for a full hour to talk me out of it, saying I didn't need it. I'd had genetic testing and came back negative, so she was very against my decision.  Tried to send me to a shink to help with my decision. My Mom died of ovarian cancer at the age of 52. I always worried about that, so I had an oopherectomy in Dec '08. Pathology report came back---the ovaries were clean! Two weeks later, diagnosed with this breast cancer. I had an two aunts who died of bc. 4 first cousins with bc. My decision was made and I wasn't changing it. Everyone's decision is personal. You have to decide what you can live with. A lot of stories have been told here, but none of our stories is destined to be yours. You are different and have to decide what's best for YOU.. Best of luck. You're in my prayers. Please come back often and let us know how you're doing. Kathy
Posts.Title: Making the Mastectomy Decision Kaidog mikita5

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2011 01:03PM mikita5 wrote: I am sooo very sorry you are having to go thru this.  As said previously, you can't fight your Mom's cancer for her... I lost my Mom to cancer also. When she heard the word "cancer" she immediately gave up.  Take care of yourself as best you can and you'll be there to take care of her... God bless you both and I have to say, God's last name is not Damn.  HE can give you both the strength you need and the help you need. I wish only the very best for both of you.
Posts.Title: I Am So Lost, Scared, and Pissed Cafelovr Hopbird

Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2010 01:35AM mikita5 wrote: Hi Debbie, I had DCIS in one breast last yr. had a bilat mx w/immediate reconstruction (DIEP). My surgery was March 31, 2009, so I'm almost one yr post mx.  The surgery is rough, but do-able.  I highly recommend the immediate reconstruction if you can do it.  Mine was a 12 hr surgery (supposed to be 14 hrs but everything was 'layed out' right up front and everything went extremely smooth, said my PS).  Take your time to research your options and take special care to find the right doctors-those who are very experienced in the type surgery you choose. If you need to talk, feel free to pm me. I'll help in any way I can. Take your time and research, research, research all your options and don't do anything in haste. Make sure your decision is the right one for you. Good luck and God bless you in this trying time. Kathy
Posts.Title: ADH Again debbys17 lacey240

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2009 11:12AM mikita5 wrote: Hello Ladies, I'm Kathy, live in WV and was diagnosed with DCIS 2008. Had bilat mx early 2009 with DIEP reconstruction. I'm like others here who didn't want to go thru the stress of another 'lump', more tests, more biopsies.  I felt I couldn't go thru this over and over and over. My oncologist, doc, husband, relatives thought I was 'crazy' for opting for this 'drastic' decision, BUT after mx, pathology came back with two more spots of DCIS in the affected breast that mamo didn't see... I followed my heart, stuck to my decision and now know it was the best decision for me. I am NOT saying this is the route to go. I'm simply saying this was MY way to deal with bc.  Everyone just needs to follow their own heart. No one else should make the decision for us. Go with your gut instinct. It's usually the right one. Blessings to us all.........and a long and healthy life!!
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: Mar 28, 2009 11:38PM mikita5 wrote: Hi Laurie: Hey girl.....it'll be ok.... I know that because I'm freaking out too but everyone tells me it's gonna be ok. . I had a meltdown last weekend and all last week. Doc gave me atovan (sp) and it's helping some. I'm leaving tomorrow for Johns Hopkins for a bilat mx and diep on Monday. I took a shower just now with the antibiotic cleaner and had a hard time looking at my breasts and realizing they'll be gone in 2 days.  It's sad that we have to go thru this mess.. I could have stayed with my lumpectomy and did the rads and tamoxifen but decided to do the bilat mx instead. I hope it's not the wrong decision because we sure can't go back and undo it.  You'll be in my prayers. Look up and try to stay positive. We have to do this , but it'll be over soon.  Mega hugs to you...... take care.. Maybe we'll see each other back here soon..
